bdgdeviceDisableBdg.name: bdgdeviceDisableBdg
bdgdeviceDisableBdg.description: Indicates if the bridge will be disabled.

bdgdeviceRestoreSettings.name: bdgdeviceRestoreSettings
bdgdeviceRestoreSettings.description: Restore the following settings to their default values: Bridge Name to ETHERNET_BRIDGE, Location to LOCAL, Port 1 Name to PORT_1, Port 2 Name to PORT_2, Port 1 Network Name to LAN_1, Port 2 Network Name to LAN_2, Ageing Time for Acquired Database to 300 seconds, Erase the acquired database, Erase the permanent database, Place sixteen default multicast addresses into the permanent and acquired databases, Type of Spanning Tree to 802.1, Type of Filtering to IEEE 802.1, Bridge Max Age to 20 seconds, Bridge Forward Delay to 15 seconds, Bridge Hello Time to 2 seconds, Bridge Priority to 8000, Port 1 Priority to 80, Port 2 Priority to 80, Port 1 Path Cost to 100, Port 2 Path Cost to 100, Restart the bridge.

bdgdeviceBdgName.name: bdgdeviceBdgName
bdgdeviceBdgName.description: The user-defined name (up to 32 characters long) of the bridge. The default bridge name is ETHERNET_BRIDGE.

bdgdeviceNumPorts.name: bdgdeviceNumPorts
bdgdeviceNumPorts.description: The number of ports present on the bridge.

bdgdeviceType.name: bdgdeviceType
bdgdeviceType.description: The type of bridge, NB25E, IRBM, or NB20E.

bdgdeviceVersion.name: bdgdeviceVersion
bdgdeviceVersion.description: The release version of the firmware installed in the bridge.

bdgdeviceLocation.name: bdgdeviceLocation
bdgdeviceLocation.description: The user-defined name to indicate the location of the bridge on the network. The default location name is LOCAL.

bdgdeviceStatus.name: bdgdeviceStatus
bdgdeviceStatus.description: The status of the bridge, ON-LINE, STAND BY or DISABLED.

bdgdeviceRestartBdg.name: bdgdeviceRestartBdg
bdgdeviceRestartBdg.description: Force the bridge to undergo a software reset.

bdgdeviceFrFwd.name: bdgdeviceFrFwd
bdgdeviceFrFwd.description: The number of frames forwarded by the bridge.

bdgdeviceFrRx.name: bdgdeviceFrRx
bdgdeviceFrRx.description: The number of frames received by the bridge.

bdgdeviceFrFlt.name: bdgdeviceFrFlt
bdgdeviceFrFlt.description: The number of frames filtered by the bridge.

bdgdeviceErr.name: bdgdeviceErr
bdgdeviceErr.description: The total number of network errors that have occurred.

bdgdeviceSwitchSetting.name: bdgdeviceSwitchSetting
bdgdeviceSwitchSetting.description: Indicates the current switch settings read from the bridge hardware.

bdgdeviceNumRestarts.name: bdgdeviceNumRestarts
bdgdeviceNumRestarts.description: The number of times the bridge has been powered up or restarted.

bdgdeviceTypeFiltering.name: bdgdeviceTypeFiltering
bdgdeviceTypeFiltering.description: The type of filtering to be performed by the bridge. The default is IEEE 802.1.

bdgdeviceSTAProtocol.name: bdgdeviceSTAProtocol
bdgdeviceSTAProtocol.description: The spanning tree algorithm under which the bridge is operating. The selections are as follows: - IEEE 802.1 compliant spanning tree algorithm environment (802.1) - DEC LAN Bridge 100 environment (DEC) - Without the spanning tree algorithm enabled (NONE) The default is 802.1.

bdgdeviceBridgeID.name: bdgdeviceBridgeID
bdgdeviceBridgeID.description: The unique identifier of the bridge. The first two bytes of the identifier are the bridge priority and the last six bytes are the Ethernet address.

bdgdeviceTopChgCnt.name: bdgdeviceTopChgCnt
bdgdeviceTopChgCnt.description: The number of times the bridge's Topology Change Flag has been changed since the bridge was powered up or initialized.

bdgdeviceRootCost.name: bdgdeviceRootCost
bdgdeviceRootCost.description: The cost of the path to the root from this bridge.

bdgdeviceRootPort.name: bdgdeviceRootPort
bdgdeviceRootPort.description: The port identifier for the port which offers the lowest cost path to the root, i.e. that port for which the sum of the values of the designated cost and path cost parameters held for the port is lowest.

bdgdeviceHelloTime.name: bdgdeviceHelloTime
bdgdeviceHelloTime.description: The time interval between the transmission of Configuration BPDU's by a bridge which is attempting to become the root or is the root.

bdgdeviceBdgMaxAge.name: bdgdeviceBdgMaxAge
bdgdeviceBdgMaxAge.description: The value of the Max Age parameter when the bridge is the root or is attempting to become the root. A time of 6 to 40 seconds is allowed. The default is 20 seconds.

bdgdeviceBdgFwdDly.name: bdgdeviceBdgFwdDly
bdgdeviceBdgFwdDly.description: The value of the forward delay parameter when the bridge is the root or is attempting to become the root. A time of 4 to 30 seconds is allowed.

bdgdeviceTimeTopChg.name: bdgdeviceTimeTopChg
bdgdeviceTimeTopChg.description: The time in seconds that has elapsed since the bridge's Topology Change Flag last recorded the value of a topology change.

bdgdeviceTopChg.name: bdgdeviceTopChg
bdgdeviceTopChg.description: Indicates if a bridge topology change is in progress.

bdgdeviceDesigRoot.name: bdgdeviceDesigRoot
bdgdeviceDesigRoot.description: The unique identifier of the bridge recorded as the root.

bdgdeviceMaxAge.name: bdgdeviceMaxAge
bdgdeviceMaxAge.description: The maximum age of received protocol information before it is discarded.

bdgdeviceHoldTime.name: bdgdeviceHoldTime
bdgdeviceHoldTime.description: The minimum time period elapsing between the transmission of configuration BPDU's through a given bridge port.

bdgdeviceFwdDly.name: bdgdeviceFwdDly
bdgdeviceFwdDly.description: The time spent in the listening state while moving from the blocking state to the learning state, or the time spent in the learning state while moving from the listening state to the forwarding state.

bdgdeviceBdgHello.name: bdgdeviceBdgHello
bdgdeviceBdgHello.description: The value of the Hello Time parameter when the bridge is the root or is attempting to become the root. A time of 1 to 10 seconds is allowed. The default is 2 seconds.

bdgdeviceBdgPriority.name: bdgdeviceBdgPriority
bdgdeviceBdgPriority.description: The part of the bridge address that contains the identifier used in the spanning tree for priority comparisons. Allowed range is 0 through FFFF. The default is 8000.

bdgdeviceUptime.name: bdgdeviceUptime
bdgdeviceUptime.description: The time, in seconds, that has elapsed since the bridge was last reset or initialized.

bdgdeviceTrapType.name: bdgdeviceTrapType
bdgdeviceTrapType.description: Contains the object identifier of the first VarBinding in the last trap generated by the bridge.

bdgPortAddress.name: bdgPortAddress
bdgPortAddress.description: The Ethernet address of the port.

bdgPortName.name: bdgPortName
bdgPortName.description: The user-defined name assigned to the port. The default port 1 name is PORT_1 and the default Port 2 name is PORT_2.

bdgPortType.name: bdgPortType
bdgPortType.description: The IEEE specification the port meets, e.g. 802.3.

bdgPortStatus.name: bdgPortStatus
bdgPortStatus.description: The status in which the port is operating. The status messages for Ports 1 and 2 are: OFF - The port is off, due to a failed network interface chip associated with that port. OK/SQE ON - The port is communicating with the network and the transceiver making the connection to the network has SQE enabled. OK/SQE OFF - The port is communicating with the network and the transceiver making the connection to the network has SQE disabled. CARRIER LOST - Communication with the network has not been established or has been lost.

bdgPortNetName.name: bdgPortNetName
bdgPortNetName.description: The user-defined name assigned to a network segment connected to the port. The default network name for Port 1 is LAN_1 and the default network name for Port 2 is LAN_2.

bdgPortFrRx.name: bdgPortFrRx
bdgPortFrRx.description: The number of frames received at the specified port.

bdgPortDisInb.name: bdgPortDisInb
bdgPortDisInb.description: The total number of valid frames that were received at the port but then discarded by the bridge in the forwarding process.

bdgPortFwdOutb.name: bdgPortFwdOutb
bdgPortFwdOutb.description: The number of frames forwarded successfully to the appropriate port.

bdgPortDisLOB.name: bdgPortDisLOB
bdgPortDisLOB.description: The number of packets that were discarded by the bridge because of a lack of buffer space to maintain the data.

bdgPortDisTDE.name: bdgPortDisTDE
bdgPortDisTDE.description: The number of frames that were intended for forwarding but were discarded when the maximum time period set for transmission was exceeded before forwarding was possible.

bdgPortDisErr.name: bdgPortDisErr
bdgPortDisErr.description: The number of frames that could not be transmitted because the frame was too large for the attached network (1526 bytes, including preamble, for 802.3 networks).

bdgPortColl.name: bdgPortColl
bdgPortColl.description: The number of collisions that have occurred on the network at the specified port.

bdgPortTxAbrt.name: bdgPortTxAbrt
bdgPortTxAbrt.description: The number of transmissions that have been aborted due to excessive collisions (over 16 attempts to transmit the same packet).

bdgPortOowColl.name: bdgPortOowColl
bdgPortOowColl.description: The number of collisions out of the standard collision window (51.2 uS). This indicates a network problem.

bdgPortCRCErr.name: bdgPortCRCErr
bdgPortCRCErr.description: The number of packets detected with Cyclical Redundancy Check failures.

bdgPortFrAlErr.name: bdgPortFrAlErr
bdgPortFrAlErr.description: The number of errors due to misaligned packets.

bdgPortPriority.name: bdgPortPriority
bdgPortPriority.description: The part of the port identifier which is used with the spanning tree algorithm when determining which port in a LAN segment has priority. The default is 80.

bdgPortState.name: bdgPortState
bdgPortState.description: The current state of the port, DISABLED, LISTENING, LEARNING, FORWARDING or BLOCKING.

bdgPortPathCost.name: bdgPortPathCost
bdgPortPathCost.description: The contributory cost of the applicable port to the overall cost of the path when the specified port is the root port. Allowable range is 1 to 65535. The default is 100.

bdgPortDesigCost.name: bdgPortDesigCost
bdgPortDesigCost.description: The cost of the path of this port to the root bridge on the network.

bdgPortDesigBrdg.name: bdgPortDesigBrdg
bdgPortDesigBrdg.description: The network address of the bridge that is assumed to be the root bridge on the network.

bdgPortDesigPort.name: bdgPortDesigPort
bdgPortDesigPort.description: The port identifier of the bridge port believed to be the designated port for the LAN associated with the port.

bdgPortTopChgAck.name: bdgPortTopChgAck
bdgPortTopChgAck.description: The value of the topology change acknowledgement flag in the next configuration BPDU to be transmitted on the associated port.

bdgPortDesigRoot.name: bdgPortDesigRoot
bdgPortDesigRoot.description: The unique bridge identifier of the bridge that is assumed to be the root bridge on the network.

bdgPortRuntPackets.name: bdgPortRuntPackets
bdgPortRuntPackets.description: The number of packets received at the indicated bdgPort that were less than the IEEE 802.3 minimum Ethernet frame size of 64 bytes.

bdgPortOversizePackets.name: bdgPortOversizePackets
bdgPortOversizePackets.description: The number of packets received at the indicated port that were greater than the IEEE 802.3 maximum Ethernet frame size of 1518 bytes.

bdgPortFrFilt.name: bdgPortFrFilt
bdgPortFrFilt.description: The number of frames received at the indicated port that were filtered by the bridge.

acqTotalEntries.name: acqTotalEntries
acqTotalEntries.description: The total number of entries in the acquired database.

acqMaxEntries.name: acqMaxEntries
acqMaxEntries.description: The maximum number of entries allowed in the acquired database.

acqStaticEntries.name: acqStaticEntries
acqStaticEntries.description: The number of addresses added to the Acquired database by the user or network manager.

acqStaticAgeTime.name: acqStaticAgeTime
acqStaticAgeTime.description: The length of time allowed for a static entry in the Acquired database to be inactive before it is dropped from the database. This time is fixed at zero.

acqDynEntries.name: acqDynEntries
acqDynEntries.description: The number of entries that have been accumulated in the Acquired database through the bridge's learning process.

acqDynAgeTime.name: acqDynAgeTime
acqDynAgeTime.description: The length of time allowed for a dynamic entry in the acquired database to be inactive before it is dropped from the database. A time from 10 - 1,000,000 seconds is allowed. The default is 300 seconds.

acqEraseDatabase.name: acqEraseDatabase
acqEraseDatabase.description: Set to zero to erase all entries in the acquired database.

acqCreate00.name: acqCreate00
acqCreate00.description: Add an entry to the acquired database to filter packets entering ports 1 and 2 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

acqCreate20.name: acqCreate20
acqCreate20.description: Add an entry to the acquired database to forward packets entering port1 to port2 and filter packets entering port2 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

acqCreate01.name: acqCreate01
acqCreate01.description: Add an entry to the acquired database to filter packets entering port 1 and forward packets entering port 2 to port 1 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

acqCreate21.name: acqCreate21
acqCreate21.description: Add an entry to the acquired database to forward packets entering port 1 to port 2 and to forward packets entering port 2 to port 1 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

acqDelete.name: acqDelete
acqDelete.description: Delete an entry from the acquired database.

acqDispType.name: acqDispType
acqDispType.description: Display the entry type, STATIC or DYNAMIC.

acqDispOutp1.name: acqDispOutp1
acqDispOutp1.description: The outbound port for packets entering port 1.

acqDispOutp2.name: acqDispOutp2
acqDispOutp2.description: The outbound port for packets entering port 2.

acqSrcAddress.name: acqSrcAddress
acqSrcAddress.description: The source address of this acquired database entry, i.e. the instance.

permMaxEntries.name: permMaxEntries
permMaxEntries.description: The maximum number of entries allowed in the permanent database.

permCurrEntries.name: permCurrEntries
permCurrEntries.description: The number of entries currently recorded in the bridge's permanent database.

permEraseDatabase.name: permEraseDatabase
permEraseDatabase.description: Erase all entries in the permanent database.

permCreate00.name: permCreate00
permCreate00.description: Add an entry to the permanent database to filter packets entering ports 1 and 2 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

permCreate20.name: permCreate20
permCreate20.description: Add an entry to the permanent database to forward packets entering port 1 and filter packets entering port 2 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

permCreate01.name: permCreate01
permCreate01.description: Add an entry to the permanent database to filter packets entering port 1 and forward packets entering port 2 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

permCreate21.name: permCreate21
permCreate21.description: Add an entry to the permanent database to forward packets entering ports 1 and 2 if those packets are destined for the specified address.

permDelete.name: permDelete
permDelete.description: Delete an entry from the permanent database.

permDispType.name: permDispType
permDispType.description: Display the entry type, STATIC or DYNAMIC.

permDispOutp1.name: permDispOutp1
permDispOutp1.description: The outbound port for packets entering port 1.

permDispOutp2.name: permDispOutp2
permDispOutp2.description: The outbound port for packets entering port 2.

permSrcAddress.name: permSrcAddress
permSrcAddress.description: The source address in this permanent database entry, i.e. the instance.

specNumEntries.name: specNumEntries
specNumEntries.description: The number of filters in the special database.

specMaxEntries.name: specMaxEntries
specMaxEntries.description: The maximum number of filters the special database can contain.

specNextFilterNum.name: specNextFilterNum
specNextFilterNum.description: The number of the next available filter that can be added to the special database.

specPort1.name: specPort1
specPort1.description: Set port 1 to filter or forward packets.

specPort2.name: specPort2
specPort2.description: Set port 2 to filter or forward packets.

specDestAddress.name: specDestAddress
specDestAddress.description: Set the special database to filter packets with a specific destination address.

specSrcAddress.name: specSrcAddress
specSrcAddress.description: Set the special database to filter packets with a specific source address.

specType.name: specType
specType.description: Set the special database to filter packets with a specific type field.

specDataField.name: specDataField
specDataField.description: Set the special database to filter packets based on the first sixteen bytes of data in the packet.

specDeleteFilter.name: specDeleteFilter
specDeleteFilter.description: Delete a filter from the special database.

pcBoardType.name: pcBoardType
pcBoardType.description: An object Identifier that indicates the type of the PC board. This will include MAC type and Media type.

pcLocation.name: pcLocation
pcLocation.description: A text description of the location of this PC.

pcMMACAddr.name: pcMMACAddr
pcMMACAddr.description: The MAC address of the MMAC that this PC is connected to.

pcMMACBoard.name: pcMMACBoard
pcMMACBoard.description: The slot number of the board in the MMAC that this PC is connected to.

pcMMACPort.name: pcMMACPort
pcMMACPort.description: The number of the port on the board of the MMAC that this PC is connected to.

pcApplication.name: pcApplication
pcApplication.description: A text description of the network application running on this PC.

pcDriverRev.name: pcDriverRev
pcDriverRev.description: The revision of the LAN card driver.

pcOnboardMemory.name: pcOnboardMemory
pcOnboardMemory.description: The number of Kilobytes of memory (eg. a 16K board would reply 16)

pcMACAddr.name: pcMACAddr
pcMACAddr.description: The MAC address of the PC card.

pcFramesXmit.name: pcFramesXmit
pcFramesXmit.description: The number of MAC frames transmitted by this PC card.

pcBytesXmit.name: pcBytesXmit
pcBytesXmit.description: The number bytes transmitted by this PC card.

pcMcastXmit.name: pcMcastXmit
pcMcastXmit.description: The number of multicasted frames sent by this PC card.

pcBcastXmit.name: pcBcastXmit
pcBcastXmit.description: The number of broadcast frames from this PC card.

pcDeferXmit.name: pcDeferXmit
pcDeferXmit.description: The number of transmit packets that were deferred due to busy media.

pcSglColl.name: pcSglColl
pcSglColl.description: The number of transmit packet experiencing a single collision.

pcMultiColl.name: pcMultiColl
pcMultiColl.description: The number of transmit packets that have experienced multiple collisions.

pcTotXmitErrs.name: pcTotXmitErrs
pcTotXmitErrs.description: The total number of transmit errors.

pcLateColls.name: pcLateColls
pcLateColls.description: The number of transmit packets that experienced late collisions.

pcXcessColls.name: pcXcessColls
pcXcessColls.description: The number of transmit packets aborted due to excess collisions.

pcCarrErr.name: pcCarrErr
pcCarrErr.description: The number of transmit packets that experience carrier sense errors (ie. lose carrier during transmission).

pcBytesRec.name: pcBytesRec
pcBytesRec.description: The number of bytes received by this station.

pcMcastRec.name: pcMcastRec
pcMcastRec.description: The number of multicasted frames received.

pcBcastRec.name: pcBcastRec
pcBcastRec.description: The number of broadcast packets received.

pcTotRecErrs.name: pcTotRecErrs
pcTotRecErrs.description: The total number of receive errors.

pcTooLong.name: pcTooLong
pcTooLong.description: The number of packets received that are too long (over 1518 bytes).

pcTooShort.name: pcTooShort
pcTooShort.description: The number of packets that are too short. (under 64 bytes long).

pcAlignErrs.name: pcAlignErrs
pcAlignErrs.description: The number of alignment errors in receive packets.

pcCRCErrs.name: pcCRCErrs
pcCRCErrs.description: The number of receive packets with CRC errors.

pcLenErrs.name: pcLenErrs
pcLenErrs.description: The number of packets whose length is not equal to the number of bytes received.

pcIntRecErr.name: pcIntRecErr
pcIntRecErr.description: The number of receive packets that experienced internal errors (eg. no receive buffers).

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Fri May 24 16:48:27 2019
